short_summary: C-GMPJ AVIONICS UPGRADE due to avionics system reaching end of life
description: This is a major avionics system upgrade project. The C-GMPJ aircraft requires an upgrade of its avionics systems, engine indicating and fuel quantity indicating systems. The scope of the project involves the replacement of these systems with modern technology, and the integration of new safety features.
duration_in_months: This is the primary tender specification document
full_summary:
### C-GMPJ Avionics Upgrade Tender

**Reference Number**: cb-45-88803845

**Solicitation Number**: 202304218

**Publication Date**: September 28, 2023
**Tender Closing Date**: October 26, 2023 (14:00:00)

**Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP)
**Tendering Procedure**: Open

**Solicitation Description**:
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) Air Services Branch requires the upgrade of avionics, engine indicating, and fuel quantity indicating systems in aircraft C-GMPJ, MSN: 534. 

**Mandatory Evaluation Criteria**:
The selection will be based on mandatory technical criteria, specifically airworthiness documentation.
 
**Trade Agreements**: This tender is covered under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Submission Guidelines**:
Submissions must be sent to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at [diane.palarchio@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:diane.palarchio@rcmp-grc.gc.ca).

**Official Languages**: Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).

**Procuring Office**:
Diane Palarchio
Procurement Specialist
Procurement, Materiel and Assets Management Branch
73 Leikin Dr. Bldg M1
Ottawa, Ontario K1A 0R2
[diane.palarchio@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:diane.palarchio@rcmp-grc.gc.ca)

**Integrity Regime**:
The RCMP uses the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada, which applies to all contracting activities. 

**Access to Solictation Documents**:
Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP) and bid solicitations can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.

**Amendments and Notifications**:
The contracting office will post all amendments, including significant enquiries received and their replies, on the GETS website. It is the sole responsibility of the Bidder to regularly consult the GETS website for the most up-to-date information. Canada will not be liable for any oversight on the Bidder's part nor for notification services offered by a third party.
